reviews.title: Terrible experience
text: I would love to give 0 if I could. This is for the lady who makes drink behind the bar. We came tonight to have a good time not to embrace the rudeness. The tone and attitude from this lady was very disturbing and rude.
The waitress was friendly and welcoming but unfortunately that still brings down the experience. Only because the waitress’s service I tipped, other wise I would love to give 0!
If you are not happy to do your job then just go find you passion instead passing all the negative vibe to everybody.  Things are not good for everybody for now and I do not need that extra.
Good luck to your business and I will NOT come back and will tell everyone I know about this place.

reviews.title: Basically Obsessed with the Rhino
text: It’s a no frills, bare minimum bar but that’s exactly all it needs to be and tries to be. There are two pool tables in the back. They show sports. They have an outdoor patio in the summer. Lots of tables inside. It’s great. It’s good for anything from going to watch the game to a low key casual date. All the food is excellent and the wait staff is friendly.

If I have one complaint it’s that sometimes homeless folks or drug addicts randomly choose outside the restaurant as a place to stand. But it’s Queen St W next to Parkdale so you can’t be too surprised.
All in all, amazing.

reviews.title: Good Food, Poor Cocktails, in a Spacious Dive
text: Terrific burgers, nachos and other pub style food at normal prices.  Cocktails are overpriced and horrible.  For example, we ordered Old Fashioned cocktails.  They were $14 each and when I asked what type of bourbon they used, they said Forty Creek.  I said a rye whiskey from Grimsby, Ontario is no substitute for a premium Kentucky bourbon and at least half the cost.  Beer was a good selection.  Service was good.  Very much a dive, with bathrooms that had no paper towels on a Saturday night, as well as out of order everything!
For twentysomethings only, wannabe trendoids or those on a limited budget.

reviews.title: Second home
text: I am a Parkdale resident and I wanted to say that this is one of the last classic pubs in Parkdale. Rhino is OG.  When The Rhino turns into condo's or a hipster vegan place, Parkdale is dead to me.

They have a huge parking lot turned into a patio, and if you want to smoke you can walk to the back and have no issues.  They also allow dogs on the patio from time to time, so if you are stuffy and want to complain about smokes and dogs, go down the street and you will find Vegandale and lots of beards.
And oh, speaking of meat lovers and non vegans,  the Rhino burger is the best lots of meat and they mix it together with more meat and spices.
They have a massive beer menu, bu the wine selection is small and meh but they added a summer cocktail menu that is reasonably priced and boozy.

Do not expect fancy here, the table and chairs are all probably from the 80's lots of wood and wooden panels in this place, including 80's style pool tables. I wish they did not get rid of the Jukebox.
Lots of space in here, massive bar, and don't judge them on the creepy basement bathrooms, there is a reason why the prices are cheap.
This place is a Parkdale classic, so if you are looking for an authentic Parkdale experience I would highly recommend this place and know you are sitting in history.

reviews.title: Great beer reasonably priced and tasty snacks
text: Had a couple of pints and some poutine and the pakoras. Friday evening was not too crowded and service was excellent.

reviews.title: Be prepared to wait
text: Had to wait close to 30 mins for 6 beers to be brought out after we'd waited 15 mins to order. The beers were pretty good, but we then had to wait another 20 mins for the bill to come out.
It wasn't a busy night so no excuse. Didn't want to tip, but apparently you have to pay for non-existent service regardless.

reviews.title: A regular
text: I have been going here for over 12 years. It is an established,  neighborhood restaurant;  with one of the largest beer menus in the city.  The best part about the pub is obviously the beer.
It is rare that a pub rotates taps so frequently and if you are curious to try and experiment;  this is the place to check out.

The food is mostly standard pub fare favorites, nachos, burgers and fries, wings. They have so Not so great Asian inspired starters ( avoid), some pasta dishes ( avoid) and specials on the weekend (hit or miss).
I have had mixed experiences obviously over the years with staff; but for the most part I find the staff to be very friendly and efficient. The owners are present often and even serving.

I think the most disappointing thing is the interior needs help stat. The upper level games area is disgusting, as is the men's room. My husband refuses to use the men's room here. This is pretty upsetting considering the volume of patrons that go through this place.
Hopefully as the baton is passed to the children of the owners;  they will inject some care and effort into these problem areas.
Food winners here: burgers; potato leek soup, wings and the beet salad.

reviews.title: Spacious patio
text: Drink selection is fine, food was pretty tasty and not too pricey. I recommend the nachos! Burgers are worth getting, though fries and poutine could have been better.
overall a pleasant experience and convenient location.

reviews.title: Fun neighbourhood spot
text: Visited with 3 friends on Saturday night of Labour Day weekend.

Enjoyed the Rhino Lager, and the food was very good. Was very pleasantly surprised by the portions and quality of the caesar salad and the 8oz ribeye steak. The steak came with roasted vegetables, which I was not expecting, and everything was very tasty.

We sat inside, which was rather quiet, and were disappointed by very slow service toward the end of our visit. Our waitress could have visited more frequently to take drink orders and check on everything, and it took about 30-45 minutes for us to get our bills and settle up - well before last call. Despite this, I would visit again.

reviews.title: Ok..but better fare in Toronto....close by..
text: I first went to the Rhino 2 years ago with a buddy who lives in the area.  Good wings, good service.  Patio is usually crowded in the summer, so get there early for a table.  No live music or anything....inside is a decent atmosphere.  It's a 'hang out for locals'.  Many of them know most of the staff...food is pretty good.  Nachos were impressive also.  Tough parking.....hipsters hangin' out.

reviews.title: Great Value for money
text: We have been to The Rhino several times and I just never thought of writing a review.
We went there last night for a pre New Years dinner with some friends and their two children.
We went at 7pm and the place was quite quiet and the waitress came over right away to take the drink orders.

We received the drinks and ordered some appetizers and our main meals, appetizers came our very promptly and once they were finished the main meals followed. The food here is excellent value for money and don't take the low cost to be indicative of the quality, they have quite a number of unusual dishes and the ones we have tried have all been very good. They have Mados wings which have a curried flavor to them and they are one of my favorite dishes there but anything I have tried there I have enjoyed.
They also have a huge beer list and again you are not paying a lot of money for this selection.
Please try his place and don't let the décor put you off as this is a local pub and you will see people from many walks of life at The Rhino.
Go and enjoy.

reviews.title: Grand Electric's Waiting Room
text: Okay, look. If you're coming here expecting a wonderful dining experience, you need to check yourself. This isn't the place for that. This a place to get some good cheap beer, hang out with your friends and have a drink while you wait for your table across the street. Service is a little slow but its never unattentive, and it's not the cleanest place in the world but that shouldn't stop you from being here. Its a good simple dive with cheap beer and if you expect anything else you should probably go elsewhere.
